text: How large (the unpacked size) are your Ember applications? Vendor / App
Its rough but I decided to have a look at my application based on <https://medium.com/square-corner-blog/optimizing-ember-templates-c479d26fe58e> and wondering how it fares in comparison to others.

attachments.title: Optimizing Ember Templates – Square Corner Blog
attachments.text: Templates make up 60% of your Ember app. Now what?
attachments.fallback: Medium: Optimizing Ember Templates – Square Corner Blog

text: I disagree a lot with that article
having hidden DOM is one of the antipatterns in spagetti code that I consider more harmful
and actually it also has a price: More dom, more memory
and more computational power
since you have to generate and render of the inside content
even if you hide it
that content might be just a string, a call to a i18n helper
another component
Oh, this article just prompted me to be more considered (and start tracking page weight). I'm :-1: on css `.hide` but :+1: on using component `tagName`.
yes, I use that too
although I don't use it for save template size
just because I don't need/want a wrapper `<div>`

> Extend Components instead of Wrapping
This is another one I disagree
It waves space, but you might be dealing with private API
unless the author gives you very clear instructions of what hooks you are expected to define
wrapping is safer
it is good, and things like `ember-metrics` where you can create your own adapters are good
but as a general advice is a bug waiting to happen
on the other hand, templates in Glimmer2 are ~ 75% smaller
this should remove a lot of this concern
also, even disregarding glimmer, templates now are big but extremely repetitive (most of that code are calls to `dom.createElement` and other DOM methods with long names
gzipping does a great job with files with this kind of repetition
<@U040MK408> Really interesting. I'm sure others would love a little counter-blog post about this. Glimmer2 template size for interesting is a really solid point!
<@U040MK408> _add that to your giant todo list :wink:
no way
I'm going to holidays tomorrow
pleace and love
nothing else
for 10 days
:sunglasses: :sunrise:
I don't want to know about your dirty holidays away <@U040MK408> :wink:

folks, is there a way to call a _route-action_ from JS? For instance in a component sometime I may want to do some initial processing with JS but then to transition to another route I'd prefer just to call up the route-chain to have a handler do that for me.
<@U04BD6KB1> <https://github.com/DockYard/ember-route-action-helper>

attachments.title: DockYard/ember-route-action-helper
attachments.text: ember-route-action-helper - Bubble closure actions in routes

text: yeah i guess that would work; you can do an "action" followed by an "route-action" right?
with the `pipe` operator
or it looks like `(pipe-action (action "doIt") (route-action "navigate"))` is the ticket
